Title: Current Food System Analysis
Objectives: Establish a detailed baseline of the global food system's structure, outputs, and impacts.
Inputs: FAO stats, IPCC reports, World Bank data, nutrient supply datasets, trade databases
Outputs: Quantified baseline: food production, land use, emissions, nutrient supply, inequities, waste

Title: Nutritional Viability
Objectives: Assess whether a plant-based diet can meet nutritional needs for all life stages and populations.
Inputs: WHO/FAO dietary requirements, nutrient bioavailability data, clinical and population studies
Outputs: Nutrient adequacy models by demographic; critical nutrients identified; variance analysis

Title: Agricultural Feasibility
Objectives: Evaluate global agricultural capacity to support a plant-based food system.
Inputs: Crop yield data, land suitability maps, FAO agricultural production stats
Outputs: Scenarios for plant-based yields; land use estimates; regional production constraints

Title: Environmental Impact
Objectives: Quantify environmental outcomes of plant-based vs. current systems.
Inputs: LCA databases, GHG and water footprint literature, biodiversity metrics
Outputs: Comparative environmental impacts by system type; hotspot analysis

Title: Economic & Supply Chain Viability
Objectives: Analyze economic feasibility and infrastructure readiness for transition.
Inputs: Cost of production models, trade flow data, labor stats, subsidy reports
Outputs: Economic viability maps; supply chain gap analysis; policy cost estimates

Title: Cultural and Political Realities
Objectives: Explore social, political, and cultural limits and levers of dietary change.
Inputs: Sociological surveys, political economy studies, cultural dietary data
Outputs: Cultural adoption barriers; sovereignty conflicts; transition sensitivities

Title: Transition Mechanisms
Objectives: Map practical tools, interventions, and timelines for systemic change.
Inputs: Policy case studies, tech readiness data, fortification feasibility
Outputs: Transition timelines; toolkits; risks and co-benefit strategies

Title: Critique and Robustness Testing
Objectives: Identify limitations, counterarguments, and uncertainties in the findings.
Inputs: Critical literature, scenario stress-tests, interdisciplinary review
Outputs: Boundaries of confidence; critical weaknesses; resilience score

Title: Synthesis and Scenario Modeling
Objectives: Integrate validated findings into final conclusions and dietary scenarios.
Outputs: Sustainable dietary models; planetary compatibility; policy recommendations
